[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@ToskiHero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55511ec563687227d1391e00#post_55511ec563687227d1391e00
What happened?[/bq]
[spoiler]To make a long story short, _was goofing around, hit my head really hard, starting bleeding pretty bad, had to go to the ER, and got a couple of staples for my head injury._ Should be back in shape in about 7-10 days. But now I feel like a fucking dumbass.[/spoiler]

Yeah, that just happened to me today.
Shit happens.[/bq]
Reposting

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55512c046368726f7aed0700#post_55512c046368726f7aed0700
Yup. The Nephila Clovata or the Joru Gumo. A sub-species of the gold orb-weaving spider. Said to be particularly loved in Japan due to their bright coloration and shape. Gold orb-weavers are venomous but their venom is non-lethal to humans. Some numbing, redness, and blistering will occur around the bite. At worst you'll have an allergic reaction and you'll have some minor respiratory problems.
